titles: By his Excellency the Lord Generall. Whereas daily complaints are made, that some disorderly souldiers under my command, contrary to the lawes of the nation, and discipline of the army, have, and still doe, commit very great outrages ...
author: Fairfax, Thomas Fairfax, Baron, 1612-1671.
notes: Title from caption and first lines of text.
Signed and dated at end: Given under my hand and seale at White-hall the fifth day od September 1649. Fairfax.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Soldiers --  Great Britain --  Conduct of life --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  Militia --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Commonwealth and Protectorate, 1649-1660 --  Early works to 1800.
